intro: Melicope degeneri, commonly known as the Hawaiian melicope, is a small evergreen tree native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and small, fragrant white flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically green when immature and turn red when mature. Melicope degeneri is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests and along stream banks. It plays an important ecological role in its native environment, providing habitat and food for various native wildlife species.
